alert.note: Alert for Boone; Hamilton; Hancock; Hendricks; Johnson; Madison; Marion; Morgan; Putnam; Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 11:24PM EDT until April 01 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Madison County in central Indiana... Northwestern Shelby County in central Indiana... Hancock County in central Indiana... Northern Morgan County in central Indiana... Northern Johnson County in central Indiana... Hendricks County in central Indiana... Marion County in central Indiana... Southeastern Boone County in central Indiana... Hamilton County in central Indiana... Southeastern Putnam County in west central Indiana... * Until midnight EDT. * At 1124 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Zionsville to 12 miles southeast of Greencastle, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Zionsville and Whitestown around 1130 PM EDT. Carmel, Westfield and Monrovia around 1135 PM EDT. Fishers, Noblesville, Mooresville, Cicero, Brooklyn, Bethany, Centerton, Lake Hart and Morse Reservoir around 1140 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Waverly, Ingalls, Lapel, New Whiteland, Pendleton, Whiteland, Edgewood, River Forest, Anderson, Greenwood, Chesterfield, Markleville, Woodlawn Heights, Country Club Heights and Boggstown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 94 and 136. Interstate 69 between mile markers 200 and 230. Interstate 70 between mile markers 42 and 106. Interstate 74 between mile markers 58 and 108. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for central and west central Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Hamilton; Hancock; Hendricks; Johnson; Madison; Marion; Morgan; Putnam; Shelby
